subject: RE: [junit] Management wants to know ...
msgSnippet: This is overly simplistic, but: - If you have any bugs in your production code, you re testing too little. - If your production code is flawless, but you have
messageBody:
This is overly simplistic, but:

- If you have any bugs in your production code, you're testing too little.
- If your production code is flawless, but you have no time to add features,
you might be testing too much.

Peter


Peter Spitz
Technical Team Lead/Principal Developer
InSystems Technologies
19 Allstate Parkway, Suite 400
Markham, Ontario
L3R 5A4 Canada
Tel: 905-513-1400 Ext. 3233

-----Original Message-----
From: tumb@... [mailto:tumb@...]
Sent: Tuesday, February 18, 2003 3:13 PM
To: junit@yahoogroups.com
Subject: [junit] Management wants to know ...



Is there any recommended (or better yet documented) ideal level of
testing?
Our company is working on adopting XP and perhaps test driven practises.
We have a question about whether certain groups are testing too little or
too much. How, if at all, do you determine what's too little or too much?
